void PySourcePSA::activePeriod ( float  timeInSeconds  ) 

This is the python Set-Accessor for the activePeriod property.

Parameters:
timeInSeconds The new period in seconds.

float PySourcePSA::activePeriod ( void   )  const

This is the python Get-Accessor for the activePeriod property.

This is the length in seconds where the source will generate particles at the rate given when its timeTriggered flag is true.

Returns:
Period in seconds of activity when timeTriggered is true.

void PySourcePSA::allowedTime ( float  timeInSeconds  ) 

This is the python Set-Accessor for the allowedTime property.

Parameters:
timeInSeconds This is the new allowedTime value.

float PySourcePSA::allowedTime ( void   )  const

This is the python Get-Accessor for the allowedTime property.

For grounded sources, the collision detection can take a long time. The allowedTime sets a maximum allowed time in seconds for the source to create its particles. The values supplied through the interface are in seconds, although the actual allowedTime is stored as CPU clock cycles (or timestamps.)

Returns:
The maximum time allowed in a frame for the SourcePSA to create particles. Units in seconds.

void PySourcePSA::forcedUnitSize ( int  newUnitSize  ) 

This is the python Set-Accessor for the forcedUnitSize property.

Parameters:
newUnitSize How many particles force(1) will create.

int PySourcePSA::forcedUnitSize ( void   )  const

This is the python Get-Accessor for the forcedUnitSize property.

This number is the number of particles created for each unit of the forced total. The default value is set to 1.

Returns:
The number of particles created per forceTotal unit.

void PySourcePSA::grounded ( bool  flag  ) 

This is the python Set-Accessor to the grounded flag.

Parameters:
flag The new value for the grounded flag.

bool PySourcePSA::grounded ( void   )  const

This is the python Get-Accessor to the grounded flag.

If set to true, each particle generated will be dropped to the terrain or scene below it. If there is no terrain or scene, nothing will be done.

Returns:
The grounded flag value.

float PySourcePSA::maximumSize ( void   )  const

This is the python Get-Accessor for the maximumSize property.

The particles generated by this source range in size from minimumSize to maximumSize, with 1.0 being original texture size.

Returns:
The maximum size value.

void PySourcePSA::motionTriggered ( bool  flag  ) 

This is the python Set-Accessor to the motionTrigger flag.

Parameters:
flag The new value for the motionTrigger flag.

bool PySourcePSA::motionTriggered ( void   )  const

This is the python Get-Accessor to the motionTrigger flag.

If set to true, the source will generate particles when the model to which it is attached moves. The amount of particles generated is dependent on the sensitivity of the source.

Returns:
The motionTrigger flag value.

PyObject * PySourcePSA::py_create ( PyObject *  args  ) 

This Python method allows the script to tell the SourcePSA to create N particles as part of its cycle.

Parameters:
args The list of parameters passed from Python. This should be an integer.

PyObject * PySourcePSA::py_force ( PyObject *  args  ) 

This Python method allows the script to force the SourcePSA to create N particles in the next update.

Parameters:
args The list of parameters passed from Python. This should be an integer.

void PySourcePSA::sensitivity ( float  value  ) 

This is the python Set-Accessor for the sensitivity property.

Note: Sensitivity cannot be set to zero - it means infinite particles would be generated on any finite displacement. If sensitivity is set below a threshold of 0.0001, it will be forced to that minimum threshold.

Parameters:
value The number of metres moved before a particle is generated.

float PySourcePSA::sensitivity ( void   )  const

This is the python Get-Accessor for the sensitivity property.

This is how sensitive the source is to movement on its model. The value is speed in metres per second.

No particles are generated if the particle system moved at less than the sensitivity. If the particle system moved at N times sensitivity, then (N-1)*2 particles would be generated.

Returns:
The number of metres moved before a particle is generated.

float PySourcePSA::sleepPeriod ( void   )  const

This is the python Get-Accessor for the sleepPeriod property.

This is the length in seconds where the source will rest when its timeTriggered flag is true.

Returns:
Period in seconds of inactivity when timeTriggered is true.

maximum Period in seconds of inactivity when timeTriggered is true.

void PySourcePSA::timeTriggered ( bool  flag  ) 

This is the python Set-Accessor to the timeTriggered flag.

Parameters:
flag The new value for the timeTriggered flag.

bool PySourcePSA::timeTriggered ( void   )  const

This is the python Get-Accessor to the timeTriggered flag.

If set to true, the source will generate particles over time according to the rate set. No particles will be generated when the particle is in its sleep period.

Returns:
The timeTriggered flag value.
